docs.title: LoRA‑Provenance
docs.text:
Turn any adapter file into a signed, traceable artifact.

  • Protect production models from poisoned LoRAs
  • Satisfy EU AI Act provenance requirements
  • Ship a one‑line SBOM for auditors

docs.title: CLI reference
docs.text:
loraprov --help

loraprov key --help
loraprov key generate --help
loraprov key list --help

loraprov sign --help
loraprov verify --help
loraprov sbom --help

Tip Run any command with --help for full option details.

docs.title: Hugging Face push filter
docs.text: Protect the Hub from unsigned / tampered adapters by rejecting them before they leave your machine.

docs.title: One‑time setup
docs.text:
# inside your adapter repo
git config filter.loraprov-clean.clean "python -m loraprov.hf_filter clean %f"
git config filter.loraprov-clean.smudge cat
echo "*.safetensors filter=loraprov-clean" >> .gitattributes

After this, any attempt to git push a .safetensors file without a valid signature will fail like:

[loraprov] adapter_sha256 mismatch (file tampered?)
error: failed to push some refs

docs.title: How it works
docs.text:
1. Git‑LFS invokes the clean filter before uploading each file.
  2. The filter calls loraprov verify <file>.
  3. If verification fails, the push is aborted with a clear message.
